description: First of all this is not a virus, just a poorly packaged application. Second, there are two versions of it for Ubuntu 19.10. The one from the snap store doesn't work at all! It runs in the background but doesn't show anything on screen. The one from the universe repo does show a screen but it doesn't show a menu (File, Settings, Help) so you can't configure it properly. I guess the problem is that it was designed for KDE so it can't work correctly in Gnome. If that is the case it shouldn't be listed.

A simple program to help recognize music elements. Good for beginners to study music by ear en piano bar.
(Fedora 31)
As a simple ear training tool it works perfectly.

this is a great tool to train your ear with note intervals chords and also scales works perfect for me up to now but i have just installed and tried it and i don't know about its future because a lot of things in Linux change for the bad side like the system itself in Ubuntu 16 it takes a few minutes to copy a giga of data and now in Ubuntu 18 you don't even know when it's done
summary: great free exercises for ear training

description: Magnifica aplicación para aprender música y tocar piano, es perfecta para niños.
me gusto bastante para que mi hijo practique piano mientras arreglo el teclado, como anillo al dedo
Excelente, solo le hace falta un tema oscuro para no dañar la vista.
no se, no funciona en mi escritorio.
Je viens d'installer ubuntu 18.04.3 et découvrir cette application qui semble super, malheureusement elle ne fonctionne pas. Pouvez-vous m'aider?
Le projet a l'air intéressant, mais pas fonctionnel sous Ubuntu 19.10.

- Septième majeure ou septième majeure?
- Euh... Septième majeure...?
- Perdu! C'était septième majeure. Nouvel essai?
- Ben... non.
